ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Is PHP more RESTful than J2EE, Django or Rails?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... What do you mean? ... If you discard state upon each request/response cycle you are are stateless. In each framework, anywhere. -- Lawrence, stacktrace.it

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Is PHP more RESTful than J2EE, Django or Rails?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=184446171; y=AiKwiCM8zUOr2P5m844TaGAmAzHlpiQnIfS2Z30uxuvFnYY
X-Yahoo-Profile: loluyede

> PHP is inherently stateless by design.

What do you mean?

>  Altho people can cheat in ways
> to make it more stateful, it cuts against the grain of each
> request-response pair being independent of other interactions.

If you discard state upon each request/response cycle you are are
stateless. In each framework, anywhere.

--
